content: It's difficult to determine which festival is the most popular among locals as it depends on the area and religion. However, Diwali, which is the Festival of Lights, is generally considered to be the most popular festival in India, celebrated by people of all religions and regions. The festival is marked by the lighting of earthen lamps, candles, and fireworks, and it symbolizes the victory of light over darkness and the triumph of good over evil. It is a time of great joy and celebration marked by exchanging gifts, sweets, and greetings with family and friends.
